channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TX
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TX

item.title: Report X-2024010791
item.description:
Report X-2024010791

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-07T15:11:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-26
  • City: FORT WORTH
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Box was found wet inside of a plastic bag in the QA damage area. Content is an Everstart Maxx Group 35 battery. Label on package is a customer return label to Walmart. DescribePack: Upon inspection, battery was not actively leaking. Some cracks were seen on top. A test strip was applied to the wet box and showed to be in the PH 0-1 range. Therefore, the moisture is believed to be battery acid from within. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Leakage was not spreading. Battery was kept in upright position during examination.

item.title: Report X-2024010742
item.description:
Report X-2024010742

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-07T15:11:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-03
  • City: FORT WORTH
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: As the package was about to go out for delivery the driver refused the package due to it being damaged. The package was then taken to our damages area where our team members caught it, and brought the package to the damaged hazmat processing area. DescribePack: The bottom of the inner packaging was cracked, this is what led to the contents falling out of the Drum. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: the package was separated from other packages and placed in a damaged hazmat tote.

Report X-2024010758

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was not upright in trailer and was leaking. It was put into a tote and given to QA. QA placed package into hazmat cage DescribePack: loose cap DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: kept upright and cap tightened

item.title: Report X-2024010771
item.description:
Report X-2024010771

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-07T15:11:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-04
  • City: BAYTOWN
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was found at 6:30 am on preload. And the hazmat was placed in the proper area. And the package had a loose cap which caused the outer packaging to get wet. DescribePack: The bottle was 2.5 liters and was sealed but the closure on the bottle at the top was leaking. And about one ounce had leaked out of the bottle. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was put in a bucket to prevent anymore leakage.

One exhibited a small leak when turned upside down, which did not happen again after cap was tightened. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Box was contained in a carrying tote when found and placed in a salvage drum during inspection.

item.title: Report X-2024010750
item.description:
Report X-2024010750

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-07T15:11:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-03
  • City: AUSTIN
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Cap Came loose during transport causing package to leak getting outer box wet. PH's alerted management/QA. QA removed package utilizing PPE, gloves, goggles and face mask, in a red lined tote and brought it to HAZMAT Cage. DescribePack: Cap came loose. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Quick clean up response and ensuring package was upright.

item.title: Report X-2024010793
item.description:
Report X-2024010793

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-07T15:11:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-26
  • City: BAYTOWN
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was being put into the trailer when the package handler dropped the hazmat box on the floor causing one of the glass jugs to break, but the other three are fine and no one was hurt. This happened on the load side. DescribePack: Package handler dropped the package instead of gently placing it on the floor of the trailer. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package was moved to an open bay door out of the trailer and away from other package handlers. the package was then picked up by QA and taken to the hazmat cage where it was delt with.

item.title: Report X-2024010778
item.description:
Report X-2024010778

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-07T15:11:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-04
  • City: BAYTOWN
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The driver from van line 5 brought the package back from delivery and package was leaking due to improper handling. And was package put in a tote to minimize further leakage. One of the three bottles were damaged and had a loose cap which caused the box to be wet and torn. And the package was laying on its side. DescribePack: The cap closure was loose which caused the spill. And leaked onto box and the other three in the box. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: The package was put in a tote after being taking of the delivery truck.

item.title: Report X-2024010164
item.description:
Report X-2024010164

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-05T15:13:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-07
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The tank car had a prior release while being switched in the yard because the pressure relief device broke and fell into the car on Dec17, 2023 (5800 report # 2023121166). The Haz Mat manager Tom Robinson put the car into a hold and told the yard manager to not move the car until a new valve was put onto the car. There was a bag applied to the missing PRD to protect the commodity. The car was moved to Englewood Yard and then back to Settegast where it was reported to be leaking again to Haz Mat manager Tom Robinson. During movement the product sloshed out underneath the bag that was covering the broken PRD. The car was set back onto the track it was originally in, and the Haz Mat Manager was assured it would not move again until the proper repairs made.

item.title: Report E-2024020014
item.description:
Report E-2024020014

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-05T15:13:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-04
  • City: MIDLAND
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG Energy, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The KAG Energy, LLC driver was delivering gasoline into the customer's storage tank. During the course of the delivery, the connection between the storage tank and delivery hose became compromised due to a broken component on the storage tank. This caused approximately 100 gallons of gasoline to be released. Allied Environmental responded to the scene and handled the remediation.

item.title: Report E-2024010517
item.description:
Report E-2024010517

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-02T15:12:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-29
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LDA experienced a UN3264 ARSURF 9590 SURFACTANT release from a 55-gallon poly drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 40-gallons of product released to a 10’ x 10’ area of the concrete dock floor as well as a 2’ x 8’ area of the trailer floor due to a container failure. The damaged drum was placed into a 95-gallon poly overpack. Absorbents and Color Safe for Acids neutralizer were deployed and worked into the impacted areas to clean the release. All impacted absorbents and PPE were then containerized into (2) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

DescribePack: Upon inspection, one of the 2 plastic containers exhibited a small leak when turned over and did not leak again after cap was tightened with a small twist. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Box was in upright condition and not actively leaking when found. Box was placed in a salvage drum for transport to Hazmat area.

item.title: Report E-2024010524
item.description:
Report E-2024010524

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-02T15:12:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-24
  • City: SANGER
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On January 24, 2024, one (1) 50-gallon drum of UN3259 was crushed in transit and released approximately three (3) pounds of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Safety and Health Consulting Services (ES&H) to remediate the impacted site. ES&H personnel utilized hand tools and absorbents to remediate the site. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 5-gallon bucket. The damaged 50-gallon drum of product was patched and placed into one (1) 95-gallon drum. Both containers were staged onsite for future disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024020004
item.description:
Report E-2024020004

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-05T15:13:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-20
  • City: AMARILLO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: GROENDYKE TRANSPORT INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver reached out due to having issues when trying to offload. Safety determined there was a leak on top of the trailer, and it wouldn’t build pressure. Safety told the driver to stop what she was doing and reached out to another driver close by to see if he could assist, then called the AMLO terminal. They found there was a check valve failure, and it wouldn’t close. They also found the trailer didn’t have some of the fittings needed and the other driver supplied them. Bleeder fitting was on the other end at customers connection instead of truck side. Driver couldn’t connect it to truck side due to not having the correct fittings so she connected to customers end connection before it goes into the building. When Driver went to open an ear on the fitting, it sprayed out, and they didn’t realize pressure was on the hose. Customer mentioned it was water soluble and sprayed down concrete with water and the drivers’ chemical suits. Driver mentions that after talking with the customer, their valve was open on the inside of the building and their system had pressure on it causing to backflow into the truck hose. Customer closed valve inside building and both drivers drain what they could in the hoses and cap hoses. After the repair was completed on the vacuum breaker she went back to unload at customer.
